Uses of Class
org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation.ComplexScalar

Packages that use ComplexScalar
Package Description
org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation
The first examples that were converted to test the annotation-driven SQL generator instead of using hand-written SQL deployment code.

  • Uses of ComplexScalar in org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation

    Methods in org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation that return ComplexScalar
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.add​(ComplexScalar a, double b)
    Add a ComplexScalar and a real (supplied as a double).
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.add​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    Add two instances of ComplexScalar.
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.logAndReturn​(ComplexScalar cpl)
    Return the same 'complex' passed in, logging its contents at level INFO.
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.minMagnitude​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    As an ordinary function, returns the lesser in magnitude of two arguments; as a simple aggregate, returns the least in magnitude over its aggregated arguments.
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.parse​(String input, String typeName)  
    Methods in org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation with parameters of type ComplexScalar
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.add​(ComplexScalar a, double b)
    Add a ComplexScalar and a real (supplied as a double).
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.add​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    Add two instances of ComplexScalar.
    static void ComplexScalar.assertHasValues​(ComplexScalar cpl, double re, double im)
    Assert a 'complex' has given re and im values, to test that its representation in Java corresponds to what PostgreSQL sees.
    static int ComplexScalar.cmpMagnitude​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    An integer-returning comparison function by complex magnitude, usable to complete an example btree operator class.
    static boolean ComplexScalar.componentsEQ​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    True if the left argument and the right are componentwise equal.
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.logAndReturn​(ComplexScalar cpl)
    Return the same 'complex' passed in, logging its contents at level INFO.
    static boolean ComplexScalar.magnitudeLT​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    True if the left argument is smaller than the right in magnitude (Euclidean distance from the origin).
    static ComplexScalar ComplexScalar.minMagnitude​(ComplexScalar a, ComplexScalar b)
    As an ordinary function, returns the lesser in magnitude of two arguments; as a simple aggregate, returns the least in magnitude over its aggregated arguments.
